CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 23, 1966, pg. 11B reads: "At Employment Workshop At PITT - When a cross-section of Pittsburgh leadership took part in seminars and discussions on the problem of fully integrating Negroes in employment and apprenticeships pattern of the Pittsburgh area during the past three weeks, these were the scenes and principals. The sessions were sponsored by Pittsburgh corporations which have signed Vice President Humphrey's "Plans for Progress" project which stresses equal opportunity in employment...Far left (right) photo: Channel 11 TV newsman Regis Bobonis leads discussion on communications while, left to right, Grace Sweeney of the Human Relations Commission, A. Samuel Milai, Art Editor of the Pittsburgh Courier and Pat Rickert of the Pittsburgh Anti-Poverty office look on..."
TitMainTitle: Regis Bobonis speaking at lectern, while, from left: Grace Sweeney, A. Samuel Milai, and Pat Rickert look on, gathered for employment workshop seminar at the University of Pittsburgh
